intro: Erigeron cupularoides, commonly known as the cupular daisy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are usually gray-green with a hairy texture. Erigeron cupularoides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and adaptability to arid conditions.
